meanings.definition: To descend from a higher to a lower place
meanings.sent1: The leaves are falling from the tree.
meanings.sent2: I saw a bird falling from the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat is falling off the table again.
meanings.sent4: Her grades are falling like a rock.
meanings.sent5: The rain falling on the roof is soothing.

meanings.definition: To come down freely by the force of gravity
meanings.sent1: The snow is falling gently outside.
meanings.sent2: I love watching the stars falling at night.
meanings.sent3: The price of the toy is falling like magic.
meanings.sent4: Her tears are falling like raindrops.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall falling down the cliff is majestic.

meanings.definition: To decrease in value or amount
meanings.sent2: The value of the house is falling due to the market.
meanings.sent3: His interest in the game is falling like a stone.
meanings.sent4: Her energy levels are falling as the day goes on.
meanings.sent5: The sun falling below the horizon marks the end of the day.

meanings.definition: To move downward or drop from a higher to a lower level
meanings.sent1: The ball is falling down the stairs.
meanings.sent2: I can see the rain falling from the clouds.
meanings.sent3: The price of the product is falling like a leaf.
meanings.sent4: Her hair falling over her shoulders is beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The snow falling softly on the ground is peaceful.

meanings.sent1: The enemy soldiers are falling one by one.
meanings.sent2: The chess pieces are falling to her strategic moves.
meanings.sent3: His arguments are falling like dominoes.
meanings.sent4: Her opponents are falling before her skills.
meanings.sent5: The fortress falling to the invaders was inevitable.
